page.title: 06RELIGION
page.content: The villages of Gt Gaddesden and Nettleden each have{churches,}which belong to the Anglican RELIGION today. Nettleden Village Church has 3 large{BELLS}which were donated in l636.2 of these are rare Thomas Harrys of London bells,of which there are only 8 in the country. The Nettleden Church has a{CONGREGATION}of only l8 people,but the Gt Gaddesden Church has between 20 & 25 regular attenders.(100 on the Electoral roll).At Gt Gaddesden Church there are at least 2 Sunday {SERVICES},at 10am in the Church & at 6pm in the Church Hall.On every other Sunday there is an additional service at 8am.The Nettleden Church has only 1 service a week, but there are several special services each year. Decoration consists of flowers provided every 2 weeks by the villagers-even non-church goers.There are Victorian lamps too.
